metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9445 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the vmnc decoder in the gstreamer allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via large width and heightvalues, which triggers a buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9445` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gst-plugins-bad-1.0 - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-hybris - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad-faad - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad-videoparsers - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
libgstreamer-plugins-bad1.0-0 - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-bad1.0 package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2').
